titleStmt.title: ❧ TO HIS RIGHT VVOVRSHIPFVL MAISTER SIR HENRY KNYVET KNIGHT, one of the ientimen of the kinges maiesties priuie Chambre.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: ❧ TO HIS RIGHT VVOVRSHIPFVL MAISTER SIR HENRY KNYVET KNIGHT, one of the ientimen of the kinges maiesties priuie Chambre.

monogr.title: Of the office of servavntes : a boke made in Latine by one Gilbertus Cognatus and newely Englyshed
monogr.author: Cousin, Gilbert

div.head:
❧ TO HIS RIGHT VVOVRSHIPFVL MAISTER SIR HENRY KNYVET KNIGHT,
• one of the ienti • men of the kinges maiesties priuie Chambre.
div.p:
ACCORDING sir, as ye bad me haue I inglishid this litle booke, of the office of seruauntes, but nat accordynge as I wolde it were, bothe to content tendereares, and also for mine owne satisfaction. Trusting your goodnes wyl with as free a minde receiue it, as I also went abowt it, albeit in many places I found the same as a glasse to see myne owne fautes in, (as I can nat tell, and am glad to belieue you ment it so)
but thereby I fynde my conscience doble discharged, in confessing the one, and fulfillynge the other. And I pray God geue your maistership longe soo to serue, as in a lesse degree we your seruauntes owght, and woulde doo.
